description:
Set up Instagram Scraper to search Instagram for profiles, hashtags, or places. Or add Instagram URLs you want to scrape directly and extract page details, posts or comments.
Important: Residential proxy is required to use this scraper!

directUrls.title: Add Instagram URLs you want to scrape
directUrls.description: Add one or more Instagram URLs to scrape. Tip: Location URLs will only scroll if you use an Instagram login.

resultsType.title: What do you want to scrape from each page?
resultsType.description: Decide what you want to scrape from each Instagram page URL or search result. Tip: You need to select the correct parent page based on URL, e.g. comments can only be scraped from posts, not from profiles.
enumTitles: Posts. You can scrape posts from profile pages, hashtags, or place searches.
Comments. You can only scrape comments from post pages.
Details. You can get details from the profile, post, or search pages.
Stories. You can get Instagram Stories from a Story page or a profile page.
Cookies. This will export any cookies generated by logging in with an Instagram account. You can use these for subsequent authorization.

resultsLimit.title: Max items
resultsLimit.description: How many posts or comments you want to scrape from each Instagram URL or found page. If you set this to 1, you will get a single post from each page. This is ignored when "Details" type is specified. Note that, if you search via hashtags or place, each found page will have this limit applied separately.

search.title: Search
search.description:
Provide a search query which will be used to search Instagram for profiles, hashtags, or places.

This field is optional, but you need to either use this field or provide Instagram URLs.
search.sectionCaption: Scrape based on search query instead of URL

searchType.title: Search type
searchType.description: What type of pages to search (you can search hashtags, profiles and places)

searchLimit.title: Search results limit
searchLimit.description: How many search results (e.g. hashtags, profiles, or pages) should be processed. If you set this to 1, you will just scrape a single search term. If you set it to 3, you will scrape three search terms, and so on.

scrapePostsUntilDate.title: Scrape until date
scrapePostsUntilDate.description: Scrapes post from the current date until it reaches a post older than the provided date. The date should be in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative time, e.g. today. By default it scrapes all posts.
scrapePostsUntilDate.sectionDescription: Use this if you only want to scrape posts or comments from a specific period of time.

fromDate.title: Scrape from date
fromDate.description: Scrapes post and comments from the current date until it reaches a post older than the provided date. The date should be in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative time, e.g. yesterday. By default it scrapes all posts.

untilDate.title: Scrape until date
untilDate.description: Scrapes post from the current date until it reaches a post older than the provided date. The date should be in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative time, e.g. today. By default it scrapes all posts.

proxy.title: Proxy configuration
proxy.description: A proxy server is required to run this actor! Either use an Apify residential proxy, or provide your own proxy servers. Datacenter proxies will not work.
proxy.sectionDescription: Select your proxy here. Remember that you have to use a proxy with this scraper. You can also change the maximum times the browser will retry requests and tell it how long to wait for the page to scroll.

maxRequestRetries.title: Max request retries
maxRequestRetries.description: Select how many times the page will be retried if the scraper is blocked or encounters other errors.

scrollWaitSecs.title: Scroll wait seconds
scrollWaitSecs.description: Select how many seconds the scraper will wait between every 100 posts/comments when scrolling. If you scrape more than 1,000 items, it is important to slow down so that the scraper is not blocked. The seconds are randomized slightly. If the scraper gets blocked, try increasing this number.

loginCookies.title: Cookies
loginCookies.description: If you want to sign in to Instagram so that you will have access to more data than with an anonymous profile, but do not wish to save your credentials in input, then you can use your cookies.
loginCookies.sectionDescription: Instagram limits access to certain data (likes, post user data, followers, and other information) if a user is anonymous. You can provide cookies here to log in as a normal Instagram user (you can copy with a Chrome plugin like 'EditThisCookie'). Note that we recommend that you do not use your own Instagram account for this - use a new, temporary Instagram account. When cookies are used, the run is limited to concurrency 1 and one session, so that the account does not get banned too soon.

maxErrorCount.title: Max error count cookies
maxErrorCount.description: Setting this number too high might get your account blocked faster

cookiesPerConcurrency.title: Concurrency
cookiesPerConcurrency.description: Set number of cookies that are used per one concurrent browser. (e.g. if set to 3 and set 6 sets of loginCookies, then it will run with concurrency 2 so each browser can choose randomly from three sets of cookies.)

loginUsername.title: Login Username
loginUsername.description: Login for Instagram account. Note that you will need to enter the authorization code that will be sent to the email address associated with the Instagram account.

loginPassword.title: Login Password
loginPassword.description: Password for Instagram account. Note that you will need to enter the authorization code that will be sent to the email address associated with the Instagram account.

likedByLimit.title: Get post likes
likedByLimit.description: If this limit is set above 0, then the scraper will attempt to load additional details about users who liked the post.
likedByLimit.sectionCaption: Followers, following, likes (only with Instagram login)
likedByLimit.sectionDescription: Features that require login. If limits in this section are set above 0, then when the scraper enters a page, it attempts to load the specified items until the limit is reached.

followingLimit.title: Get profile following
followingLimit.description: If this limit is set above 0, then the scraper will attempt to find users followed by the profile owner.

followedByLimit.title: Get profile followed by
followedByLimit.description: If this limit is set above 0, then the scraper will attempt to find users who follow the profile owner.

extendOutputFunction.title: Extend Output Function
extendOutputFunction.description: Add or remove properties on the output object or omit the output returning null
extendOutputFunction.sectionDescription: You can change the output of the items for your dataset here, or add additional behavior to the scraper.

extendScraperFunction.title: Extend Scraper Function
extendScraperFunction.description: Advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page
extendScraperFunction.prefill:
async ({ page, request, label, response, helpers, requestQueue, logins, addProfile, addPost, addLocation, addHashtag, doRequest, customData, Apify }) => {
 
}

customData.title: Custom data
customData.description: Any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function

expandOwners.title: Query post owner
expandOwners.description: If this feature is used, then for each post the scraper will attempt to query additional details about the post owner. This will drastically slow down the crawling speed and increase the chance of an account ban if credentials are provided.
expandOwners.sectionDescription: Warning: the features in this section are highly experimental, can result in a ban of an Instagram account if logged in, and might cause the scraper to fail.

maxConcurrency.title: Max Concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Max number of allowed instances running in parallel. More instances need more memory!

useStealth.title: Use stealth
useStealth.description: Enable stealth in case of increased blocking.

debugLog.title: Debug Log
debugLog.description: Enable a more verbose logging to be able to understand what's happening during the scraping.

includeHasStories.title: Include Has Stories
includeHasStories.description: If this feature is used, then for each user detail property has_public_story from xhr request is parsed.

includeTaggedPosts.title: Include Tagged posts
includeTaggedPosts.description: Get the tagged posts for each profile
